events.title: Angioplasty
events.description: A major coded entry indicating that the patient underwent an angioplasty procedure, which is typically performed to open narrowed or blocked blood vessels that supply blood to the heart. This procedure is significant for patients with peripheral vascular disease, as it can improve blood flow and reduce symptoms associated with the condition.

events.title: Paranoid Disorder
events.description: A major coded entry indicating a new episode of paranoid disorder, which is a mental health condition characterized by intense and irrational mistrust or suspicion of others. This diagnosis is significant as it may require ongoing management and treatment to ensure the patient's mental well-being.

events.title: Urine Creatinine Level
events.description: A coded entry indicating a urine creatinine level of 4.8 mmol/L, which is elevated and may suggest impaired kidney function or other underlying health issues. This finding is significant as it may necessitate further investigation and monitoring of renal health.

events.title: Asthma Control Test
events.description: A coded entry indicating an asthma control test score of 24, which suggests that the patient's asthma is well controlled. This is significant as it reflects the effectiveness of the current asthma management plan and the patient's adherence to treatment.

events.title: Clostridium Difficile Toxin Detection
events.description: A test result indicating normal detection of Clostridium difficile toxin, which suggests that the patient is not currently experiencing an infection related to this bacterium. This is significant as it helps rule out a common cause of gastrointestinal symptoms.

events.title: CT of Head
events.description: A minor coded entry indicating that a CT scan of the head was performed, which may be relevant for assessing neurological conditions or injuries. The significance of this event lies in its potential to identify underlying issues that could affect the patient's health.
